article: Theree times a week we have to drive to physical therapy for my husband's hand that was reattached two months ago after a borrible work accident.  Today we _ thirty minutes late but just a few miles into the trip we saw a young man struggled against the _ winds that were almost pushing our car off the road. We stopped and asked if he needed a _ .He accepted in no time and _ jumped into the back seat. His name was Dan and he wasn't going far.  As we dropped him off, we _ he had many large piles of cut wood stacked in his yard so we _ if he was interested in selling any. He said, "Oh, you can just come by anytime, even if I'm not here and _ up all you want."We asked how much it would cost for a trunkload. He replied, "It's _ ,take all you want. We have more than we'll use and we're _ at home so just drop by anytime and get it. Thanks for your help and have a great day!"  We kept _ we'd pay for it and would only get it if someone was home, but he just kept repeating _ he'd already told us. Then as his _ pit bull dog came and gave me a _ on the hand, Dan said, "Come on, boy!"They both took off racing to the doorway and Dan yelled one last time,"Thanks again!" What _ me most about his offer is that he was in the back seat and didn't saw my husband's hand. One of his fingers is _ now and they are patched up with the two skin grafts , meaning it doesn't have the _ it used to. Dan just _ us with the wood, never knowing how much that would mean to us now when my husband isn't able to _ any for us this winter.
